## Why do we need this kind of structure?

::: columns
::: {.column width="70%"}
-   Each country exploiting fisheries resources must declare its activities ([**transversal variables**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"} like capacity, effort and capture)

-   To whom and why?

    -   [**European Commission**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"}, if EU member, used for example regarding [**fisheries agreements**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"}
    -   [**RFMOs**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"} ([**R**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"}egional [**F**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"}isheries [**M**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"}anagement [**O**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"}rganisations) to manage [**population dynamics**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"}
:::

# Data collection

[On board and on shore sampling]{style="color:#00a9d6; font-size: 1.5em"}

## Data collection

### [Why do we need to collect these data?]{style="color:#00a9d6"}

::: columns
::: {.column width="60%"}
-   [**Compliance**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"} : Regulations from the RFMOs
-   [**Scientific purpose**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"} : Stock assessment (catches and biological parameters)
-   [**Provide quality data**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"} :
    -   Data independence: limiting conflict of interest between fishing business and regulation
    -   Minimize biases: crew estimations reported in logbook
:::

::: {.column width="25%"}
![](images/offshore_picture.png){.absolute top="200" left="700" width="30%"}
:::
:::

## Data collection

### [What do we need to collect ?]{style="color:#00a9d6"}

::: columns
::: {.column width="60%"}
-   [**Estimation catch characteristics**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"} of the purse seine fisheries (catch and effort by species, size distribution of the catch)
-   [**Region**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"}: Atlantic and Indian ocean
-   [**Sample area**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"}: ICCAT and IOTC fishing ground
-   Only [**main ports**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"} are covered (Abidjan, Dakar and Victoria)
-   [**Primary sample unit**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"}: landing
:::

::: {.column width="30%"}
![](images/offshore_picture.png){.absolute top="200" left="700" width="30%"}
:::
:::

# Data storage

[Information System]{style="color:#00a9d6; font-size: 1.5em"}

## Data storage

### Administration {style="color:#00a9d6"}

-   Administration of a [**database management system**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"}
    -   Design and programming operations for the collection, storage, processing and restitution
-   Ensure data quality, [**identify**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"} and [**correct**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"} errors
-   Ensure data [**security**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"} and [**integrity**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"}
-   Ensure that data confidentiality is [**respected**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"}

## Data storage

### Quality and security {style="color:#00a9d6"}

-   [**Data quality**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"} : constraints like integrity, data type, and pre/post-integration check
    -   Check the data before and after integration in the database
    -   Limit the length of the sample sizes to realistic values
    -   Check the consistency of the fishing season
-   [**Data security**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"} : protecting against catastrophic failures and intentional wrongdoing
-   [**Security measures**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"} : fault-tolerant disks, off-site backups, authentication, access rights, VPN, IP-based access control, and encryption of data exchanges.

## Coordination

### [At European Union scale]{style="color:#00a9d6"}

-   [**R**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"}egional [**C**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"}oordination [**G**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"}roups

## One specific characteristic

### [Focus on the EU]{style="color:#00a9d6"}

::: columns
::: {.column width="70%"}
-   Each entity negotiates [**on its side**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"} and is responsible for providing data
-   The EU :
    -   [**coordinates**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"} all these tasks (for [**RFMOs**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"})
    -   [**guarantees**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"} the monitoring of the fishing quota(s) by European fishermen
    -   gives more [**impact**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"} on the international scene
:::
